items.q: Which part of the body is responsible for pumping blood?
items.explanation: The heart acts as the central pump for the circulatory system.
Bats can see, but rely heavily on echolocation in the dark.

items.q: The main bone of the leg is called the femur.
items.explanation: The femur is the longest and strongest bone in the human body.

items.q: What group of animals has dry, scaly skin and lays eggs?
items.explanation: Reptiles include snakes, lizards, turtles, and crocodiles.

items.q: What type of scientist studies animals?
items.explanation: Zoology is the branch of biology related to the animal kingdom.

items.q: What is the green substance in plants that helps them make food?
What do bees produce that humans love to eat?
items.explanation: Bees create honey from the nectar of flowers.

items.q: Name the five basic human senses.
items.explanation: These are the traditional five senses.

items.q: What is the hard, outer skeleton of insects called?
items.explanation: It protects and supports their bodies.

items.q: What kind of animal only eats meat?
items.explanation: Carnivores have a diet consisting primarily of animal tissue.
